title: Man in critical condition after Chase St. burglary
content:
Police are investigating several shootings in the central city and North Toledo.
A Toledo man remained in critical condition after an aggravated burglary at 12:56 a.m. Friday in the 2000 block of Chase Street.
Michael Miller of Toledo was inside a residence when several unknown men entered through an unlocked back door.
He was shot once in the side before the gunmen left.
He was taken to Mercy Health St. Vincent Medical Center.
Police said he is expected to survive.
Officers also responded to shots fired about 11 a.m. Friday in the 800 block of Virginia Street, near Glenwood Avenue.
Police said Monique Lane of Toledo was treated on scene by Toledo Fire and Rescue Department for a minor gunshot wound to her arm.
Authorities stopped a vehicle matching a witness description and took several people in custody for questioning.
About 11:30 a.m. Thursday, an unidentified gunman fired from a vehicle at Grand and Miles avenues.
Jewett Richardson of Toledo walked into ProMedica Toledo Hospital at 12:09 p.m. for treatment of a gunshot wound to his right side. Police described his injuries as not life threatening.
Shots were also fired about 3:44 p.m. Thursday near a vigil for a slain juvenile.
An unidentified man fired several times at another man at Scottwood and Nesslewood avenues.
No injuries were reported.
Desmont Kendall, 17, was fatally shot in that area about 1 a.m. Sunday.
Deshawn Darden was shot in the leg there about 2 a.m. Monday.
A total of 117 people have been shot this year in Toledo, including 15 this month, according to a Blade review of police reports.
